topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552ee9fe63687267435e3800#post_552ee9fe63687267435e3800
No dude; if someone gets gangrene infection that means the limb is in necrosis meaning that they *HAVE* to cut the limb off or else it will kill the person.  Another weakness of his is super cold water.  If you're not used to cold water and step in freezing cold water in say antartica your limb will freeze and they'll have to cut it off.

Basically any severe medical problem is his weakness, cause he is still biologically human.

Other things that could kill him:
Nerve gas
MRSA
Polio would cripple him.
HIV
Liver cancer
Ebola
Radiation poisoning
etc


. . . No wonder why super heroes wouldn't work in real life, villains would just gas them with nerve gas and they would die.

"No need to fear!  Super-hero man is here!"
*villain fires a nerve gas canister at them and it is ruptured*
"Oh no!  Nerve gas!  One of my many biological weaknesses!"
*dies*
